t: Amazon.com: Jones Soda Co.
s: Since 1996, a small team of dedicated soda enthusiasts have made it their sole mission to keep you refreshed with real cane sugar sweetened soda. Jones Soda comes in a variety of classic and Jones-y flavors in glass bottles, cans and now available on fountain!

s: Made with pure cane sugar and featuring the most unique packaging in the beverage industry, Jones Soda is a one-of-a-kind premium craft soda known for its bold, unique flavors, colors, and ever-changing labels submitted by our consumers. #thepeoplescraftsoda

s: April 14, 2025 - By 2000, over 85% of its revenues came from the Jones Soda brand, and the company officially changed its name to Jones Soda and moved its headquarters from Vancouver to Seattle. In November 2006, Jones Soda announced that it would replace high fructose corn syrup (HFCS) in its products with ...

t: Jones Soda - Non-alcoholic drinks
s: The captivating history of the Jones Soda brand dates back to 1995, when Victor John Penner and Peter Van Stolk joined their creative minds in Vancouver to create a company that would shake up the soda world.

t: Jones Soda – American Soda
s: Jones Berry Lemonade Soda! Deep in the the darkest recesses of the Amazon rainforest, there lives a unique sloth. While all the other sloths go through life eating sloth food and doing sloth things, this particular creature only feasts on the ripened berry-lemons that grow in the canopies.

t: Amazon.com : Jones, Soda Strawberry Lime, 12-Fluid Ounce (24 Pack) : Soda Soft Drinks : Grocery & Gourmet Food
s: Strawberry Lime is the best flavor of Jones Soda that I have tried so far. Orange Cream is a close second. The pure cane sugar and glass bottle prevent any aftertaste in the soda. Jones Soda also uses less sugar on average than your typical Coke and Pepsi HFCS brand sodas.

s: Ya gotta make a living somehow we chose the beverage world. Good old soda with a twist. No hidden meanings, no billion dollar ad campaigns. At Jones, we want you to buy a lot of soda and recycle the bottles. The labels are kinda like our minds - always changing.
